name: ethnic
content:

C1 relating or belonging to a group of people who can be seen as distinct (= different) because they have a shared culture, tradition, language, history, etc. : A question on ethnic origin was included in the census. They are the second largest ethnic group in Kenya. The factory's workforce reflects the ethnic mix from which it draws its labour. They are ethnic Hungarians (= whose families originally come from Hungary) living in Romania.
sometimes offensive seen as different or interesting because of coming from a culture or tradition that is not Western : ethnic food ethnic costume
More examplesFewer examplesThere are 40 ethnic groups among the school's pupils, who speak many different languages.Judaism is both a religion and an ethnic group.Poverty has risen among most racial and ethnic groups.We do not discriminate on the basis of background or ethnic origin.Many Southeast Asian nations have large ethnic Chinese and Indian populations.Television should reflect the ethnic and cultural diversity of the country.Have ethnic tensions in the area been reduced by intermarriage?
